nasha_partitions_zfs_atime_description: Disables the need for the kernel to update file access time every time it's requested.
nasha_partitions_zfs_sync_description_st: Secured profile: combines stability with an adequate level of efficiency. First, files are written and then all elements are wiped in order to ensure data stability.
nasha_partitions_zfs_sync_description_al: Highly-secure profile: Your file transfers will be more stable at the expense of performance.
nasha_partitions_zfs_sync_description_di: Unsecured profile: Very high-performance but dangerous option as the ZFS ignores synchronous transfer requests (BDD, NFS, etc.).
Administrators should use this option only if they clearly understand the risks.
nasha_partitions_zfs_modal_success: The ZFS options will be modified shortly.
nasha_partitions_zfs_modal_fail: There was an error when modifying the ZFS options.
nasha_partitions_zfs_modal_loading_fail: There was an error when loading the ZFS options.
